benchmark_details.name: MM-OR (Multimodal Operating Room)
benchmark_details.overview: MM-OR is a realistic and large-scale multimodal spatio-temporal dataset designed to advance operating room modeling and enable multimodal scene graph generation.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive resource for studying robotic-assisted surgical workflows and advance operating room modeling.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: MM-OR includes only total and partial knee replacements in one OR, which may limit generalization.

data.source: Recorded multimodal data from robotic total and partial knee replacement surgeries.
data.size: 92,983 timepoints with 25,277 annotated entries totaling 500GB of data
data.format: Various formats including RGB-D video, audio, robotic logs
data.annotation: Manually annotated with panoptic segmentations and scene graphs by trained annotators.

methodology.calculation: Macro F1-score for evaluation across multiple predicates in scene graph generation.
methodology.interpretation: Higher scores indicate better performance in recognizing and predicting surgical actions and interactions.
methodology.baseline_results: F1 Score of 0.529 for scene graph generation.
methodology.validation: Models evaluated using F1-scores across various configurations of modality utilization.

targeted_risks.harm: Invasive procedures might introduce risks such as infections or incorrect placements.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: Data anonymization processes were implemented during data collection.
